attributes.action: ask the Secretary of State at the DCSF to delay signing funding agreements with the Harris Federation and Oasis until a a review of Croydon Council's tactics in circumventing opposition to their plans have been investigated
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
* Croydon Council are proposing to make Haling Manor into a Harris Academy and Ashburton Junior, Infants and Secondary Schools into an Oasis Academy.
* Haling Manor was recently praised by Jim Knight for its achievement putting it into the top 3% in terms of CVA.
* Croydon Council have consistently delayed giving information to parents and the wider community.
* They have refused to respond to challenges which factually question their statements.
* Details of the public meetings were only released 4 weeks into the statutory consultation period.
* At the public meetings, parents and the public were restricted to asking questions.
* Time was not allowed for everyone to ask questions
* Both Croydon Council and sponsors wrongly challenged facts given by opposers of the scheme, implying that they were lying. 
* By controlling the format of the meeting, denying a voice for opposition and deliberately issuing disinformation, the Council has denied parents a choice.
